website_summaries.verdict: A feature-packed, fast-charging, high-performance tool that reacts to your hand input and adjusts power supply accordingly.
pros: Combination of gyroscope and variable speed gives great control
High torque output well managed by multi-position clutch
2 batteries means nonstop work if necessary
cons: It takes a while to get the best from the gyro action, and it’s quite large for this kind of tool

customer_reviews.title: The gyroscopic mechanism is un-useable in tight spaces
customer_reviews.text: The only way to make this screwdriver actually work is to pull the trigger and then rotate the whole thing 45-90 degrees one direction or the other (clockwise for forward, counter-clockwise for reverse). The issue is that if you are working in a tight space, you might not have room to rotate the whole tool 90 degrees.... rendering it useless. If the tool had a manual switch override, like for "Forward, Reverse, Gyroscopic", then this tool would be great... but it doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: E.S.

customer_reviews.title: Save your wrists!
customer_reviews.text: As an electrician, something like this is great for tedious tasks that utilize long machine screws such as trimming out receptacles and switches. The gyro function is easy to adapt to, and the swiveling handle is a useful feature when you really want to torque something down (this small screwdriver has a surprising amount of power if you need it to actually drives screws into wood or sheet metal) It is compact enough to keep in your tool pouch all day, all my friends at work marveled at the sight of it! Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Decent torque, programmable clutch & compact!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I need a compact set of tools, and this was the most compact screwdriver/drill I could find. Definitely not for heavy-duty construction jobs, but it will drill a hole, drive 1 1/2 screw into a 2x4. Plus it really shines for more delicate jobs when you want the clutch to avoid the risk of stripping a screw. Finally took looks cool, feels solid and gyroscopic control is better than exoected.!
customer_reviews.author: TechGuru101

customer_reviews.title: Amazon return policy is deceiving!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tool for just about 3 months and only used it a few times. The charger has already failed and won't charge either battery. Amazon refers me to Dewalt for service and the nearest service center is over an hour away. I am completely disappointed in this purchase and in Amazon for not allowing me to return a faulty item. Walmart.com and Target.com are starting to look a lot better and they don't charge you a large fee for membership that seems to grow every year or two.
customer_reviews.author: Greg's Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I like Dewalt products, but didn't agree with the positive reviews. It requires a turn of the wrist to get the bit moving and even then, it didn't have much power. I returned it after one use and went with a higher volt type.
customer_reviews.author: DKH

customer_reviews.title: DeWalt,how far down the rabbit hole have you gone❓❓❓
customer_reviews.text: Brand new out of sealed box. Charged up the battery pop it in had NOTHING!!️ Not much to know about this item on how to use it-however giving it the benefit of a doubt I reread the instructions. It was not me at fault. The piece of 💩 had a bad trigger switch. This was the last straw for me. No more DeWalt for me. The DeWalt I grew up with no longer exists. Save your aggravation and look to another brand.
customer_reviews.author: John Wayne Lea

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long ?!?  This is GREAT!!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a cordless screwdriver for many years but having a cordless drill, it seemed silly: WRONG! This is light... maneuverable... holds the charge for a long long time... two bright LED's. I didn't feel I needed two batteries and I was right - it recharges quick. Another perk is the gyro "switch" that I learned immediately: rotate slowly to start the screw then rotate more to drive it in. Nothing to it. I've used it as a drill to make pilot holes for screws and it works great for that too. The ONLY negative is I had to buy the bag too - guess I can use it for a lunch bucket. Well done DeWalt!
customer_reviews.author: BeemerPilot

customer_reviews.title: The ease of use and flexibility it the best.
customer_reviews.text: This battery powered screwdriver is uniquely user friendly and technology used in an intuitive way. If you want turn a screw into something a slight twist to the right, want it to go faster, turn it a little more. Same with removing a screw only you twist left. Light weight, good torque adjustment, long lasting/fast charging batteries (I bought the package with two included). You can work on small screws in tight spaces with the extender and with the highly effective speed management control you won't be stripping screws going into plastic or thin metal. Very handy for working on computers, ceiling fans, or small appliance, as well as bigger household job. Dewalts got a winner here.
customer_reviews.author: WBD

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars for the first year, 1 star thereafter
customer_reviews.text: I would give this Five Stars based upon design functionality and performance, but two Stars based on longevity. Just after one year, of course out of warranty, I began to lose bits, the chuck would not hold them any longer, and about the same time, it began to become very weak, struggle and shut off under the slightest load. I've had Hitachi and Makita screwdrivers and like this one the best, but the longevity is just isn't there. I did not use it daily, probably average a few times a week. So if you're not going to use it heavily I recommend it, but if you use it for your work you might plan on replacing it every year
customer_reviews.author: beulah

customer_reviews.title: Best Tool I Ever Bought
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the most used tool in mt tool arsenal. I love that it has the light, it makes it easy to see what you're doing without needing a flashlight or a drop light. I bought one elsewhere, and lost it, so I HAD to get a new one. I did not want to be without it. I did find the other one, so now I have one for my work bench and one for my car. The one I had for several years I only charged the battery once. The battery charge lasts forever. Comes in a great carrying case also. Great Buy. You'll love it, I guarantee it
customer_reviews.author: Dennis P.

customer_reviews.title: Metabo HPT cordless screwdriver AAAA++++
customer_reviews.text: this unit was used for removing screws on switch plates and outlets a lot (which are small easy screws) the gyro system fails and the batteries last less then 2 hours. I went through 2 of these within a month and finely had to send both back and request a refund. This tool was put on the market without extensive testing. Caution buyers. I give this tool a NEGITAVE review. save your money as this tool is over priced for the quality. As for Amazon, a great and responsible company and will continue to buy from them. Metabo HPT cordless screwdriver made by Hitachi is the best on the market
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Learned to Like
customer_reviews.text: Let me be honest, when I unboxed this tool and tried it for the first time the first thought was "oh, I don't like this at all. The proportional rotation control just didn't feel right...for fifty years you pull a switch, and for the first thirty is was 0-100%. Well, this old dog has learned that I really like the proportional rotation control. Once I drove a few screws in it became very natural. The rotating handle is wonderful; most times I use it in the 90 degree position but for those tight situations the straight body works great. I would certainly recommend this tool to anyone from the pro to the beginner.
customer_reviews.author: John J. Baich

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought this months ago !
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful tool. A simple twist or your wrist in the direction you want to screw, or unscrew, makes it so simple. Powerful, not an impact driver, but just right for light to medium duty. I changed my tail light bulb is a just a few seconds with this, even in the dark of my driveway, it has led lights on it also. Awesome tool, better than I hoped for. After reading about it, and doing my research on which model to get, I made the right choice. Love this thing !
customer_reviews.author: Cullen A Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Great power and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Just because it was new I was concerned about using the gyroscopic aspect of it but it is easy and rather intuitive. Trying to use my drill as a power screwdriver took up extra time of constantly swapping bits and there were some times where my drill just wouldn't fit where I needed it to go. Problem solved. No more sore wrists after swapping out items all day long while using a regular screwdriver either. It's light weight and decently powerful. The battery lasts a good amount of time. Using both batteries gives a full days worth of constant use. The light is very appreciated bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Other better value options available.
customer_reviews.text: Saves time on long screws still need to hand tighten. Pros 1. I like that it turned screws. 2. I liked that it was DeWalt. 3. I liked that it could go from straight to 90 degrees easily. Cons 1. Didn't like the unnecessary gyroscopic operation. 2. Didn't like fixed low torque of tool.
customer_reviews.author: Max Imman

customer_reviews.title: great time saver
customer_reviews.text: This is the first cordless screwdriver I have used in years. The ergonomic features are really nice and it is easy to hold and control. It makes quick work of screws that don't require much torque. However, I used it to remove some toggle screws from fluorescent lamps on the ceiling and it struggled with at least half of them because they were too tight. Once I loosened them by hand, it was able to run the rest of the way out which did make the job easier. I like the tool and it will work fine for the light stuff.
customer_reviews.author: HarleyBear

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Screwdriver. Very innovative!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this screwdriver. Very innovative. I see bad reviews for the battery life. Thankfully, I haven't had problems yet. I carry mine is a little holster at work and if I don't push the lock button, the holster will press the power button and operate the driver. So I learned to push the lock button right below the lower button when not in use. The driver takes about 10 seconds to learn how to operate. Turn it left to unscrew and turn right to screw in. Turning slow makes it slow. Turning faster makes it screw faster.
customer_reviews.author: J. Guilfoyle

customer_reviews.title: Gyroscopic Fantastic Tool
customer_reviews.text: This means you have to turn the unit to the right or left in order to get to work right. I want to add more. This is a fantastic tool and it takes a little bit getting used to it. To start the tool you need to press the trigger and then turn it to the right for foreword and the speed varies with how fast you turn your hand. To go in reverse you need to turn it to the left and again the speed varies by how fast you turn your hand. You won't be disappointed with this one. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: J R Difilippantonio

customer_reviews.title: Great So Far
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing so far. The little bag is perfect for holding the Dewalt Max, charger, batteries, small bit sets, a couple of manual heavy duty ratchet bit holders (regular and palm drive for tight spaces). I'm not aware of other tools which compete with the DeWalt Max combination of features: small size and weight, LED work lights, pistol grip to inline conversion, replaceable batteries, adjustable clutch, gyro activation feature. Hopefully it will last for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: bestatchess

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure if I would like the gyroscopic actuation, I do! It works great and allows a lot of "touch" for light assembly operations. At 8 volts it's not for high torque applications but I have regularly achieved 40+ in-lbs with the max setting (confirmed with a torque meter). I have used it mostly in the pistol configuration, but occasionally have used it inline, nice to have that option. I'm developing assembly procedures for an item with many threaded fasteners, this tool has exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: knls

customer_reviews.title: You won’t be screwed!
customer_reviews.text: If you know anything about DeWalt, you know your buying quality. This is just that, quality. This was bought for my mother as a simple around the house power screwdriver and lite duty drill. I would recommend this for small jobs with little torque needed. Body feels strong and durable just as any other drill you would buy from DeWalt, and the rotate feature is a great feature. Battery seems strong and long life... but after draining and charging for a couple months... only time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Angevine

customer_reviews.title: Great idea. Tightens or loosens with a turn of ...
customer_reviews.text: Great idea. Tightens or loosens with a turn of the wrist. No more fumbling for the reverse/ forward switch. Variable speed. Takes a little getting used to since it is all in the wrist turn. Powerful enough to drive a 1 1/2" screw into a 2x4, but don't do it often. My first one wore out in several months and would no longer drive a screw. Fits in my side pouch so I can use it for many things. Best for smaller fasteners in electrical lights fixtures and switches and outlets. Also works well for doorknob, deadbolt installations, latches, cabinet hinges, etc. Use in combination with hex drive drill bits, screw tips and small sockets.
customer_reviews.author: Excelsior

customer_reviews.title: My every day tool
customer_reviews.text: My best and most frequently used tool. This thing saves my wrist and forearms. Getting older, turning screws is not fun. This make assembly of things faster and easier. The two position grip is easy to adjust. Battery life is great and comes with two batteries. The quick release chuck makes changing bits easy. Great for hanging things on drywall with anchors. Just need a hex drill bit and hex Phillips head bit. I use this screwdriver practically every day.
customer_reviews.author: BrianAndCyn

customer_reviews.title: Quickly Became a Favorite!
customer_reviews.text: This little screwdriver is powerful and intuitive to use. I just finished disassembling a cedar deck. I removed 1.5" and 2.5" SS screws without a problem - dozens of them on the same charge. There is a single button that activates it, but it rotates left, or right by twisting it in the same direction. It is variable speed depending upon how far it is twisted. It has an excellent chuck that slides and locks in place. It was a bit pricey, but well worth the $90.00 cost. Mine came with a charger and two batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Twist to Turn
customer_reviews.text: The Twist to run function takes some getting use to, you press the button and twist towards the needed rotation. It doesn't feel that powerful, but it is. I stopped buying DeWalt years ago, but got this with the 2nd battery deal and so far has been great. As a long time homeowner, I put this to use nearly everyday. Battery life has been surprisingly long!
customer_reviews.author: La832

customer_reviews.title: Very well designed, very comfortable to hold and powerfull
customer_reviews.text: I use this mostly for small engine repair (R&R engine parts). This is a major upgrade from my old Ryobi and so far, I really like it.. The only thing I would have preferred is a WALL MOUNT CHARGER, vs a separate, stand alone one. For myself, working on my work bench, I had to make up a "holder" to store the driver so It wasn't getting banged about/taking up counter space. The included bag, for me, is useless...
customer_reviews.author: SRT

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!  Some reviewers are using it incorrectly...
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly! Some reviewers are using it incorrectly though. There is no need to flick your wrist after pressing the trigger. You only need to pull the trigger and then rotate the tool slowly in the direction you need it to turn. You will feel it hum when you pull the trigger. This is normal operation. One of the handiest Dewalt tools I've bought in a while. Saved me loads of time building some RC car kits. I've since used it for various projects around the house.
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice electric screw driver for home use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I like DeWalt products in general and wanted an electric screwdriver for working on PC's. It's pretty neat, the gyroscopic feature is cool but honestly, I feel more gimmicky than necessary, but it's still cool and seems to respond nicely to the rotation of my wrist. I really like that it has a removable battery so I can easily just swap it out for a charged one and keep working. So far I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: moons

customer_reviews.title: How I feel about it
customer_reviews.text: Slight twist of the wrist or arm and it gets going. Use it all the time behind furniture and other tight spaces. battery lasts a long time and it’s pretty powerful too. Love it because it’s so light and portable. You’d be surprise at how many knobs and hinges and faceplate and other screws are loose in your house. No you clearly won’t build a house with it, but you can put together furniture and do most house repairs with it. Showed it off and had friends buy it too.
customer_reviews.author: Josiah

customer_reviews.title: Not a Useful Tool
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an electric screwdriver to do light woodworking projects around the house. This DeWalt got lots of praise for the way it works when you move the angle of it. My problem is that it is not capable of driving screws into soft wood. Very disappointing performance. I expected better from DeWalt. It is small, fits in the hand nicely. The light is nice. The batteries are fine. Just not enough power to do small jobs.
customer_reviews.author: James G. Ligon, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Does not last!
customer_reviews.text: I used it for a few jobs early in 2018, and was very satisfied. Then I put it away for a while. Just tried to use it at the end of 2018. Battery dead and the charger will not charge it (flashing red light means bad battery). There was an extra battery in the kit, but the battery (though it indicates fully charged) will not operate the drill which remains dead. Am very disappointed in this gyroscopic screwdriver and battery system though I have been happy with the 20V Max series of tools. Dewalt should do more to maintain its reputation for quality!
customer_reviews.author: Boomer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the shop
customer_reviews.text: I have the original handheld screwdriver, and was super excited to see this could rotate into being more of a drill driver. It is light duty, but I have loved the original and looking forward to using this one. The rotating gyroscope management system is awesome. Delta has made a winner. Batteries are too expensive if you ask me. They should have a 30-40% off for owners of their products. Just a suggestion.
customer_reviews.author: CRDubleU

customer_reviews.title: Not a great product
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for about five months. I bought it for light housework. Problem is, it's not really a great solution for any particular situation. It's way under-powered for actually tightening much of anything, yet bulkier and more awkward to use than a regular screwdriver for lighter applications. I usually just end up getting out my full cordless drill. At $100, this thing really isn't useful enough to justify the price.
customer_reviews.author: beedle

customer_reviews.title: Loving!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to take some of the manual work out of repairing radio controlled cars and trucks. It has made my repairs fast and easy. Love the light. Gyro works fantastic in all orientations so far that I have tried. Charges quickly. Probably not the most heavy duty of screw driver so know its limitations. For me working on RC Traxxas trucks its just fantastic. Wish I had gotten one years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool To Have
customer_reviews.text: I have been in the HVAC business for 34 years, never really a fan of electric screw drivers. I have been very old school, using hand held screw drives and nut drivers. I bought my first Dewalt cordless screw driver about two years ago, these things rock. Great battery life, compact in size. .....not Like carrying around bulky cordless drill. I highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Ken Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Works 50% of the time.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is just plain dumb. Why didn't they just put a damn trigger on it? I am a home inspector and use it every day. It is a terrible tool that works as designed about half the time. I have to take out the battery and put it back in almost every time I use it. I am also a general contractor and have an arsenal of drills...this one just went in the trash can. Worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Totally amazing tool!
customer_reviews.text: How did I get through 50+ years of life without this tool? I swear, a gyroscopic screwdriver is one of the most revolutionary and useful tools in my toolbox, and Dewalt's is as perfect as you can get. It makes installing and removing a lot of screws into a totally painless, almost fun endeavor. The battery lasts for months between recharges, the light is bright, the grip is comfortable, it has tons of torque, and it works like magic! What's not to like?
customer_reviews.author: BWA10

customer_reviews.title: Not As Much Torque As Expected
customer_reviews.text: Product worked fine and price was quite good so a smart value. It takes some getting used to the gyroscopic feature. I would be just as happy with a loosen/tighten button. The flexible position capability is good and it is reasonably compact. I had hoped it might replace an old 1/4 inch 12V drill/screwdriver I had from B&D which I really loved but it no longer recharges. It did not, I still needed to purchase a drill.
customer_reviews.author: Donna M.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: One of my coworkers had the one with the non swivel handle, but I like this one better since it won't roll around. The extra battery is a nice thing to have, because it always seems that when a battery dies, it dies when you are actually needed to do something. Battery life it excellent and the battery indicator is a good gauge of how much "juice" you have left.
customer_reviews.author: p51d007

customer_reviews.title: Died in a couple of months
customer_reviews.text: It only worked for two months and died! I did not used it for any hard work rather than some screws around the house. One day put the battery to charge, and after I installed it in the screwdriver it literally died. A real bad smell came out from it (smell like burned circuit). The worst is that it happened a couple of weeks after the available return end date, so now I only have to throw it and try to find another screwdriver from another manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Hugo Pascual

customer_reviews.title: Must have screwdriver!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second screwdriver of this type. My first was liked so much by the person I let borrow it that they never returned it. I love it. Takes some getting used to (about 5 minutes) but it’s so nice not having to use anything but changing wrist position to change direction of rotation. The one purchased through amazon has two batteries! Although I have never ran battery out from full charge, I have forgot to charge n ran out on day three or four, so the second battery is great and being included is almost like getting 30-40% off since you don’t have to buy additional expensive battery. Excellent deal really n delivered in two days despite COVID-19.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Ward Randall Warren, MD

customer_reviews.title: Great for all types of workloads! Especially PC Building!
customer_reviews.text: I love this screw gun as this thing makes putting together PC's easy and simple. Not more twisting away over and over when all I have to do is just twist in the direction of loosening the screw or tightening it. Its brilliant and affordable! for such a little device it has so much power behind it and I really appreciate the quality and power of Dewalt's product. The light built in is great especially in tight spaces of computers or other items that need screws loosened and tightened! Do not hesitate to but this because i is really portable and useful in many industrial and non industrial ways.
customer_reviews.author: CJ Carty

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt Gyroscopic Screwdriver
customer_reviews.text: My son-in-law had one of these and demonstrated it to me. I ordered one when I got home and it is one of the most used tools inside my home. With a twist of the wrist you are either tightening or loosening the job before you and it has plenty of torque for household jobs. Further the ability to change it to a pistol grip or standard screwdriver format is a great feature along with an LED to light the work area. Great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Bus Lamp

customer_reviews.title: What Great Technology
customer_reviews.text: For a little cordless screwdriver, this thing packs a little punch. Works very well, has more power than expected ... which is nice but not expected/needed (have BIG cordless drills/drivers for those jobs). The gyro sensing mechanism that drives the unit depending on the direction and amount of the twist is pretty cool & handy. For it's intended use I'd say the 8 volt battery is just perfect!
customer_reviews.author: CTA

customer_reviews.title: DeWalt continues to blow me away
customer_reviews.text: I have had many brands of cordless man toys, dating back to when you were cool having a 9.6v Ni-Cad Makita. Now all I have is DeWalt, which lasts forever. I picked this lil guy up for inside the house. My wife and I love it. It has amazing torque for its size and is very intuitive to use. It doesn't matter what position you start it in, just twist (right tighty / lefty loosy) and she goes. The amount of twist also controls how fast she goes. Nice tool!
customer_reviews.author: JayP

customer_reviews.title: Not strong enough to do simple jobs!!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know who did the rating on this product but this is not the best hand held screw driver that DeWalt makes. The Battery is not strong enough to even do the smallest task! It i a great idea but needs more voltage. I thought I would like the gyroscopic technology but it is not worth the hassle of reset the position to start from so the drill will activate. So I would like to send back to you. You don't have to reimburse me but I can not take it back to retailer.
customer_reviews.author: CurleyBob1957

customer_reviews.title: A Toy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a Dewalt unit I had for several years. Spent a fair amount of time trying to match the unit I was replacing but failed miserably. My best description of this unit is its an expensive toy. Very lightweight and hardly any torque....not suited for construction. Good for a hobbiest maybe but I don’t have a hobby to use it on. Well, enough said.
customer_reviews.author: Robert and Pat Arnold

customer_reviews.title: ... work installing plugs switch’s and light fixtures and it’s great it’s very lightweight and fits in your pocket and ...
customer_reviews.text: I’m an commercial electrician apprentice and I bought this tool for finish work installing plugs switch’s and light fixtures and it’s great it’s very lightweight and fits in your pocket and easy to use It’s better than carrying my impact around now I only use my impact when I need it the 8v has good torque power too and the battery last me about a day and a half of constant work and I highly recommend this over the model that’s a little cheaper and doesn’t fold or have torque settings I had both and both are good this ones just more worth it
customer_reviews.author: Hexs

customer_reviews.title: Handy little tool.  Definitely get yourself the one with dual batteries if you plan on using this frequently.
customer_reviews.text: Took some getting used to the gyroscopic controls. But once mastered, it was a nice tool to use. I would give it 4 stars for battery life, although it is only 8v so I wont ding it for that and you get an extra battery, guess Im just spoiled with the 18 and 20's. I do like the handle that positions from pistol grip to straight grip and that it easy to control the torque once you get used to it, so for that it earns its 5 stars over other comparable products. And of coarse its a Dewalt, and performs as such!
customer_reviews.author: Darrin Weber

customer_reviews.title: This is my second one. They are great.
customer_reviews.text: I already had the DCF681 version of this. It is the go to tool in the house. Love how it works for small jobs. Although it isn’t powerful enough for major work (things that need lots of torque). I bought this model because it has the adjustable clutch. I use this one for hobby work like rc cars. Some of the beadlock wheels have a hundred small screws. This allows me to zip thru them with the clutch set low so I won’t strip any threads. Absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Green

customer_reviews.title: Great design and functionality.
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical of the gyroscopic action of this screwdriver. Until I started using it its quite easy to use and not at all uncomfortable. I liked it so much I bought my Dad one for Father's day. He really likes it as well. He has problems with twisting his wrists but finds this easier to use then turning a regular screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: C,J Hayenga

customer_reviews.title: First one didn’t work.  Second works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: The product came quick but didn’t work. At full charge, I can feel and hear the motor spinning, but the driver won’t turn. I expected more from Dewalt. Update: Props to Amazon customer service as always. They sent me a replacement, I sent the old one back and this new one works great.
customer_reviews.author: Seven P.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the right application.
customer_reviews.text: Depending on what you are planning in using it for, it’s either perfect, or useless. I work in HVAC, and use it Almost daily for light service and maintenance, it fits easily into my bag. But when it’s time for installs or heavy service, I have to break out the big guns. Bottom line, I love it and would recommend to anyone, so long as they understand its limitations.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Ward III

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight Drill for simple everyday tasks
customer_reviews.text: We use this drill for simple little projects around Lee Display. When youre going from one project to the other, it's a lot easier to keep your tool belt lightweight so you can move freely from one task to the other. And this drill is perfect for that. Carrying around a heavy duty drill isnt necessary all the time. This little one is great.
customer_reviews.author: EST. LEE DISPLAY L D 1902

customer_reviews.title: Best cordless screwdriver I have owned
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several cordless screwdrivers over the years and this is the best one yet. It is not heavy but has plenty of power. It is an ideal tool for using around the house. I love the gyroscope activation which give me control over the speed. The indicator showing how much battery life is also a great feature. I would recommend this to anyone needing a cordless screwdriver to use around their home.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fesperman

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t hold up!!!
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought this was amazing. Then the novelty wore off and reality kicked in. The “tool retention chuck” I guess you call it broke. It’s a great idea if you use quality parts. I suppose it’s good for the layman, just don’t expect any semblance of longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: BEST TOOL I'VE EVER BOUGHT!  Don't be afraid of the gyro control
customer_reviews.text: Updated Review: This turns out to be the BEST TOOL I'VE EVER BOUGHT (and I've bought a lot of tools)! I've only had mine a short time, but it seems like a good tool. I was afraid of the gyro control at first. However, it becomes intuitive pretty quickly. Just remember, its a screwdriver and not a drill.

customer_reviews.title: stopped working after 4 uses

customer_reviews.text: This is what you get when you put screw driver on a Wii controller. It was somewhat awkward to control in the beginning but your brain picks up very quickly. To be honest it is much more intuitive to use then the forward/reverse button system. Lefty loosey righty tighty. That's all you have to remember to use this tool.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: My favorite tool!
customer_reviews.text: This has got to be my favorite tool right now in my tool bag. I was doing some work and i let a guy who was there helping me use it and he fell in love with it and was going to purchase one. He even showed it off to one of his buddies since he was so impressed with it! Cant go wrong with a good quality tool by a brand that has been tested to the extreme!
customer_reviews.author: Veryrreal

customer_reviews.title: Love DeWalt Products
customer_reviews.text: This is the go-to hardware for professionals and I can see why. I am a computer tech and have a need to work better and more efficiently and this helps. DeWalt is what the sales rep at Home Depot many years ago told me was what all the pro's buy. Now it's the only hardware electrical tool I also will buy.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Thomasian

customer_reviews.title: great screwdriver
customer_reviews.text: these are great. My wife bought me one for Christmas a few years ago, great battery life, good power, easy to handle and the gyro function really works slick. I just bought this one for my brother-in-law who was helping me with a basement remodel job and really liked mine. Best power screwdriver i have used.
customer_reviews.author: KatManDoo

customer_reviews.title: Terrible job by Dewalt the worst screwdriver I ever used
customer_reviews.text: This screwdriver was a huge disappointment. When it showed up I was super excited to replace my old Tool Shop cheapo that used 4 AA batteries. I charged up the 8V Dewalt & the thing was a disgrace. The button is so screwy that you don't even know which way it is going to turn or if it even did half the time the LED lights came on & it just hummed. Dewalt missed their mark on this one it is a total disgrace as all my shop tools are Dewalt & I am happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: good hand-sized power screw driver
customer_reviews.text: i picked it because its a good quality brand, and was exactly as shown. only just got it a few days ago, used it already and works great! It's a small sized hand held tool, great for those odd jobs around the house, and not super heavy, and well made, (not cheaply). thanks! i'm glad choose the 2 batteries with charger. the bag is small, just big enough to store the full kit.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: good drill but may need some tech difficulties worked out with the Gyro feature.
customer_reviews.text: worked well for a few months and then when trying to screw on a face plate for RJ45 connectors the drill just stopped working. not sure why but haven't had for even a year and it broke. no smells or burns. didn't drop it, just stopped working in mid drill. still hoping i can turn it in for a new one. its durable (other then it just breaking while using) strong drill force. able to get in tight spaces. I think it may have something to do with the Gyro feature for it. cool feature but might need some bugs worked out for it. may be the problem for why it doesnt work now.
customer_reviews.author: Blitz

customer_reviews.title: Get 'Em While You Can
customer_reviews.text: These are getting hard to find. They have disappeared from both Blue and Orange Big Box stores. I was fortunate to find these on Amazon. Very clever design and super useful for doing work where a large drill might be overkill. The direction you twist your wrist - just like you would a manual screwdriver - is the way the bit turns. The more you twist the faster it goes. Great Dewalt quality. I hope they are simply bringing out an improved version and not discontinuing this great product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Takes a few minutes, but then it's rolling.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, first thing to know is this this is gyroscopic. If you just push the switch, it will not move. You have to move your arm in a clockwise or counterclockwise position while holding the switch and it this thing moves. No more changing a switch to make it go right or left. Just turn your wrist. I've had several cheap powered screwdrivers for small jobs while keeping my Dewalt drills for the bigger things. I've probably spent $100 in throw away mass produced garbage electric screwdrivers in the past two years. This should last many years and provide more power.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Braddock

customer_reviews.title: It's so intuitive to use , that it's easy and comfortable !
customer_reviews.text: I've "loaned " to a friend of mine to use this for hanging pictures in her house ; it is so easy to use and lightweight , that I don't foresee getting it back any time soon . I gladly went and bought a another new one for myself . I'm NOT letting ANYONE use my new one ! They can look , but not touch !
customer_reviews.author: mario

customer_reviews.title: Good tool, poor torc
customer_reviews.text: Overall, not a bad tool to have in the chest. Replaced a room full of electric receptacles. The drill came in handy. My only real gripe is it doesn’t have much torc. I was unscrewing a frame on a mirror. On its strongest setting it couldn’t break them. I had to do it by hand. Didn’t take much effort, really. That was annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert Delgadillo

customer_reviews.title: Your need one! Trust me!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is incredible. Replace your regular screwdriver for a serious upgrade and a step away from carpel tunnel! Strong enough to send a wood screw into a 2x4 yet has a light touch to put a screw into an outlet cover without stripping the paint. Would absolutely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: 6 years and still going
customer_reviews.text: Bought mine in 2014 the batteries that came with are still working fine. The unit works just as well as it ever did. This is a good buy, you may on occasion need a more powerful driver. But for most instances, this will get the job done and is easy to get out and use.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Moorman

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had a Black and Decker Gyro for years and love it and saw this and had to have it. (Black and Decker owns DeWalt) It works the same as the Gyro, but has a clutch and replaceable battery and it can be used straight. I use it with the handle flipped down and grip it so my palm is right behind the center of the handle where the bit is and then it's very easy to rotate your hand left and right to control both the direction and the speed.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite tool :)
customer_reviews.text: This is a second DeWalt Gyroscopic Screwdriver I am buying. I love it so much that decided to have one for outside and for inside work. Both drivers are running without any issues. The package I received was very well packaged and absolutely brand new. FYI - there is another DeWalt Gyroscopic Screwdriver, but is not bending handle to be a gun like and has no control for power adjustment. So this one is a clear winner.
customer_reviews.author: N. M.

customer_reviews.title: It's a Dewalt.  Expect greatness and got it.
customer_reviews.text: Great little screwdriver. The only odd thing was you turn on an angle and it starts up. Not a big deal and it is so good, quick and definitely does the work. We are pleased with it and it just shows you get what you pay for and with Dewalt it is always a quality item.
customer_reviews.author: M.V.

customer_reviews.title: Cool useful tool (light duty)

I was not paid or bribed into this review I have Milwaukee tools for work and this is the only tool I have from dewalt
customer_reviews.author: Merle Mauer

customer_reviews.text: Takes a little while to get used to the automatic feature but it works okay. If given the choice I would never pay extra for this feature. I would have been happy if it just had a direction switch that I couldn't accidentally hit during use, like the one on the Ryobi it replaced. The best feature is the ability to turn on the light while attempting to insert the bit on to the screw head. Most other screwdrivers only turn on the light while the bit is spinning. Totally useless feature.
customer_reviews.author: MikeJA

customer_reviews.title: Great for my arthritic hands!
customer_reviews.text: I just finished building a large number of cabinets and benches for my shop and I'm extremely pleased with this tool. I built many frames with 2x4's using 2-1/2" pocket screws. The screwdriver had plenty of torque to seat these big screws. Battery life was excellent. I then used the screwdriver to install the tiny screws in the door hinges...just adjust the clutch and no more stripped screws. I wish I would have bought this tool a long time ago- a great tool and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: nicky korte

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to install (6) 70 inch bamboo wood blinds in our sunroom since arthritis in my hand would make it difficult. This tool was well worth the purchase. No pilot holes required, plenty of power for the job. I was impressed with the operation of slightly turning the tool in the direction needed.
customer_reviews.author: Scott K.

customer_reviews.title: All my tools are Dewalt and are great. needed a little driver so I thought Dewalt
customer_reviews.text: All my tools are Dewalt and are great .needed a little driver so I thought Dewalt, Wow what a mistake, no power will not tighten or loosen anything. Gyroscopic sucks, stay away from it. Try not to leave anything but I hate it.

customer_reviews.author: Julie M

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the money. And it's DeWalt.
customer_reviews.text: It's a very nice tool. A bit different to get used to with the gyroscope system. You actually turn your hand left or right to get the tool to turn in that direction. But for my particular purpose the tool works great. I'm using it to work on radio control cars and trucks.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: I am normally a Milwaukee Took customer, but Milwaukee's ...
customer_reviews.text: I am normally a Milwaukee Took customer, but Milwaukee's answer to a powerful cordless screwdriver was a 12v drill. I ship control boxes that I have to close after inspection, placed waist height with me screwing downward, making a gun grip very uncomfortable and raising the issue of tendonitis or carpal tunnel. I need a screwdriver that can go stick as well as drill because, in this environment, the hand position is more neutral when the screwdriver is configured as a stick. This a loss for Milwaukee, but a win for Dewalt. This was definitely money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: R. J. Sprawls

customer_reviews.title: Descent but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: It's descent. Battery life is fair but not great. The gyro is a pain when working in tight spaces as you must twist the whole device a lot for it to speed up. It should have a function to disable the gyro and screw either direction manually. The torque it outputs it's fairly low. I expected more. Overall it's overpriced for what u get. But it will still do a variety of jobs, just not as many as it should be able too.

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, lightweight yet powerful drill

The built in light is an added bonus. And being able to switch between the straight grip and the handle grip is very easy and helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany C

customer_reviews.title: The best electric screwdriver I’ve ever had!
customer_reviews.text: The best electric screwdriver I’ve ever had and I’ve had a bunch. You can not go wrong with this BUT be sure to buy the set with 2 batteries, charger and bag. The cheaper tool/battery/charger is a different screwdriver without the articulating handle.
customer_reviews.author: JWC

customer_reviews.title: Favorite tool

customer_reviews.author: John Mark Prince

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I don't use the torque clutch as it works like a standard screwdriver, the harder you turn it, the harder it drives the screw. Unlike a trigger, there is direct feedback between the torque on your wrist and how hard the screw turns in. My only beef is with battery life and power, but the tool wouldn't live in my tool belt if it were larger and I doubt any tool that size could be stronger than this electricians wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Best Tool in the Kit!
customer_reviews.text: This handy screwdriver is well made and extremely useful. It is my favourite tool for my work. The fact that it is small makes it easy to tuck into a toolcase without being clumsy. It can fit into tight corners otherwise restricted to manual screwdrivers. The batteries last a LONG time. I have had this screwdriver for 5 months and only re-charged the batteries once, each. I use this tool each workday, all day. It also has no problem loosening any screw so far. I am amazed at how powerful this screwdriver is for its size. I highly recommend it for anyone serious about their work and operating efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Kay

customer_reviews.title: Great driver
customer_reviews.text: I was initially skeptical of the gyroscopic feature, but after much use I’m growing to like it. I thought you might have more precision with a traditional finger control, but this works just as well in tight spaces, particularly in the straight configuration.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Lane

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Gyro control is NOT a gimmick! It just takes a little getting used to. The forward and reverse switch in my experience is usually the first thing to give me trouble on my power screwdrivers so this should eliminate that issue.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen B.

customer_reviews.title: Sooooooo gooood
customer_reviews.text: This tool is the best. It works how its supposed to. I just started a new hobby (rc trucks) and this tool makes my life so easy. I have a losi baja rey and to remove the body on it would take forever but now its quick and easy. It have levels on how much torque you need to be at and has a build in light when ever you start it up. Its a great tool and it comes with a extra battery. Get the tool. Hurry now.
customer_reviews.author: Kingsley Troy Llego

customer_reviews.title: Tough, versitle tool that delivers
customer_reviews.text: Awesome mini-drill/driver. Was skeptical at first, mainly about the newfangled "Motion Activation Variable Speed and Reversing Control"(which actually worked pretty slick once I got used to it). I did quite a bit of research prior to purchase because I wanted the perfect compact driver for me, one that would perform and easily fit in a tool pouch; based on that, my runner up was the Makita. Ordered the Dewalt, and was initially impressed but wanted to see how this tool would stand up to the test of time(much use/abuse included), as the others I've purchased had not... 6 months later, WOW! Still going strong. Dewalt has a winner here. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I'm a dewalt guy and the tool is very nice but it didn't work right out of the box. On a dead battery it was working ok but when I fully charged the battery (logically thinking it would work perfectly), the gyroscopic feature when going left and right would shut off the tool completely. The button would have to be realeased and the tool placed back to starting position and then press the tool and move your wrist again to start it up. But the thing is, it would shut off every time i would turn back the opposite way. Not worth $100.
customer_reviews.author: ROSALIA

customer_reviews.title: Hard to teach an old dog a new trick
customer_reviews.text: After using a standard pistol grip drill for 30+ years it is very difficult to get used to the gyro. I'm sure it's just a matter of using it more often, but it takes me much longer to do simple tasks trying to get used to it. Other than that, the clutch, size, weight, strength, adjustable handle are really nice.

customer_reviews.title: After 5 years, it has lost power
customer_reviews.text: Bought this almost 5 years ago for home use and I recently went to screw in some screws into plywood and I think the motor must have burned out because it will now only screw and unscrew looser screws. I am debating whether it was worth it and buy again or get a different brand. What's the expected lifespan of these tools?

product_meta.title: DEWALT 8V MAX Cordless Screwdriver Kit, Gyroscopic, 2 Batteries (DCF680N2)
product_meta.description: Style:Two BatteryThe DEWALT DCF680N2 8V MAX Gyroscopic Screwdriver 2 Battery Kit features motion activation which allows the user to control variable speed, along with forward and reversing action by simply twisting the tool left or right. Motion activated variable speed ranges from 0-430 rpm; intuitive motion activated control allows for precise fastening into wood, plastic and light-gauge metal. Adjustable two-position handle allows the user to choose either the straight in-line position or pistol-grip configuration and the 15 clutch position settings allow control when completing light fastening applications. This work light also features 2 LED headlights which enables illumination in confined areas without shadowing. Battery indicator on the tool allows end users to know when to charge packs - one pack covers 5 days of runtime with the typical user. 8V MAX battery pack allows for longer run-time and charges in one hour. One-handed loading 1/4" hex-shank chuck allows for quick screwdriver bit change and holds 1" bit tips. This is an Ideal tool for any professional end user looking for a compact, portable screwdriver with precise speed control. Applications include: #8x1 5/8" Drywall Screw into 2" x 4" SPF, #8 & #6 Machine screw insertion and removal, #6 & #8 Cabinet hardware screws, electrical switch and outlet wall plate screws. Kit includes (1) 1 hour charger, (2) 8V MAX compact batteries and Kit Bag,.
